dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""I have nothing to say to you. Get..."
dialogueTree.text: "I have nothing to say to you. Get out of my sight."

links.title: You: ""You actually *witnessed* the lynch..."
links.text: "You actually *witnessed* the lynching?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm sorry to say I did, officer."..."
links.text: "I'm sorry to say I did, officer." The man gives a solemn nod.

links.title: Logic: "He didn't see the hanging, he saw t..."
links.text: He didn't see the hanging, he saw the little *show* staged by the Hardies. Let him talk. He may know more than even he knows.

links.title: You: "(Turn to the lieutenant.) "This is..."
links.text: (Turn to the lieutenant.) "This is just the break we've been looking for!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Easy, detective. No need to jump t..."
links.text: "Easy, detective. No need to jump to conclusions." He eyes the spectacled man near the window, who smiles and spreads his hands.

links.title: You: ""Is it because you did it, Mr. Vill..."
links.text: "Is it because you did it, Mr. Villedrouin?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Because I *did it*?" the man scoff..."
links.text: "Because I *did it*?" the man scoffs.

links.title: Composure: "He's clearly not a man accustomed t..."
links.text: He's clearly not a man accustomed to being spoken to in that manner, let alone to being accused of *murder*.

links.title: You: ""My apologies, I misspoke. I mean,..."
links.text: "My apologies, I misspoke. I mean, what did you see?"

links.title: You: ""Don't jerk my chain, paper-jockey...."
links.text: "Don't jerk my chain, paper-jockey. You did it, didn't you?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What's the meaning of this?" He lo..."
links.text: "What's the meaning of this?" He looks first at you, then at the lieutenant. "Is your colleague here trying to *arrest me*?"

links.title: Empathy: "He sounds almost mocking, saying th..."
links.text: He sounds almost mocking, saying those words -- *arrest me*.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There is no meaning, sir. Please e..."
links.text: "There is no meaning, sir. Please excuse my colleague. This case has... been a great strain on his nerves."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Back off -- *now*! This man has dip..."
links.text: Back off -- *now*! This man has diplomatic immunity. It serves no good to accuse him of a crime he didn't commit.

links.title: You: ""Kim's right. I'm sorry. I haven't..."
links.text: "Kim's right. I'm sorry. I haven't been myself lately."

links.title: You: ""What gets on my nerves is *murdere..."
links.text: "What gets on my nerves is *murderers*. Why'd you kill him, man?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What's the meaning of this?""
links.text: "What's the meaning of this?"

links.title: Logic: "Back off -- *now*! This man has dip..."
links.text: Back off -- *now*! This man has diplomatic immunity. It serves no good to accuse him of a crime he didn't commit.

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. Let's start over. My ne..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. Let's start over. My nerves got the best of me there."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, I can certainly understand *..."
links.text: "Well, I can certainly understand *that*." The man loosens his tie knot and appears to relax slightly. "That hanging was a surreal play. Everything since then has been too..."

links.title: You: ""It means the jig's up, creep. I am..."
links.text: "It means the jig's up, creep. I am the law!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I won't stand for this." His left..."
links.text: "I won't stand for this." His left eye starts twitching -- as the last warning. "What's your name? I'll have your badge!"

links.title: You: ""*I* don't even have my badge -- so..."
links.text: "*I* don't even have my badge -- so spin on this!" (Give him the finger.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant goes pale. 'No badge..."
links.text: The lieutenant goes pale. 'No badge?' he mouths to himself, silently.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You're a disgrace to the RCM. Out..."
links.text: "You're a disgrace to the RCM. Out with you, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""My name's Harry.""
links.text: "My name's Harry."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Very well, *Harry*. You're a disgr..."
links.text: "Very well, *Harry*. You're a disgrace to the RCM. Get out of my sight, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good god, detective. One more stun..."
links.text: "Good god, detective. One more stunt like that and they'll have you institutionalized."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now let's go, before you get us in..."
links.text: "Now let's go, before you get us into any *more* trouble."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Remember that guy, Ace Ulsterberg?..."
links.text: "Remember that guy, Ace Ulsterberg?" the redheaded officer asks. He leans against the doorframe while his bald companion is hunched over an open filing drawer...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""The guy who got canned for trying..."
links.text: "The guy who got canned for trying to arrest that diplomat?" the bald man asks. "Well, *technically* he got canned for being shit-faced on the job. But yeah, trying to arrest the ambassador from Gottwald *while* shit-faced was probably a contributing factor..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The bald man squints at a file, the..."
links.text: The bald man squints at a file, then returns it to the cabinet. A new drawer opens with a grinding screech. He turns back to the redhead in the doorway. "What made you think of him now?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Don't know. He just kinda popped i..."
links.text: "Don't know. He just kinda popped into my mind." "Ahem, excuse me, Chester," says a female officer who threads her way into the file room. "Where is old Ace now?" the bald officer asks.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Here the female officer chimes in:..."
links.text: Here the female officer chimes in: "I believe he's part of a certain bureaucrat's security detail." "No fucking way!" The redhead is dumbfounded. "How'd he pull that off?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Family connections, I'd imagine? H..."
links.text: "Family connections, I'd imagine? His father-in-law works for the Office of Standards and Best Practices." With that, the woman exits, a grey file folder tucked under her arm.

links.title: You: ""Harrier Du Bois, and don't forget..."
links.text: "Harrier Du Bois, and don't forget it."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Very well, *Mr. Du Bois*. You're a..."
links.text: "Very well, *Mr. Du Bois*. You're a disgrace to the RCM. Get out, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""I am Detective Raphaël Ambrosius C..."
links.text: "I am Detective Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau, at your service."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You're doing me no service! Get ou..."
links.text: "You're doing me no service! Get out, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""Around these parts I go by Tequila..."
links.text: "Around these parts I go by Tequila... Tequila Sunset."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What kind of name is that? You're..."
links.text: "What kind of name is that? You're a disgrace. Get out, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""I'm in-between names right now.""
links.text: "I'm in-between names right now."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You'll be in-between jobs soon! Ge..."
links.text: "You'll be in-between jobs soon! Get out, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""You can just call me *The Law*.""
links.text: "You can just call me *The Law*."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You're a disgrace to the law! Get..."
links.text: "You're a disgrace to the law! Get out, this instant!" He points at the door.

links.title: You: ""Start from the beginning, if you d..."
links.text: "Start from the beginning, if you don't mind."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer, it's very difficult to de..."
links.text: "Officer, it's very difficult to describe what I saw that night. It was so surreal to me, like in a play."

links.title: Drama: "He holds out his hands and blossoms..."
links.text: He holds out his hands and blossoms his fingers, like a drama teacher setting the scene.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is already scribblin..."
links.text: The lieutenant is already scribbling down notes. "What do you mean, 'like in a play'?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, no." The man shakes his head...."
links.text: "No, no." The man shakes his head. "I mean it was so strange I could barely believe what was happening..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I was on the balcony when it happe..."
links.text: "I was on the balcony when it happened, getting some fresh air. I remember that first they came in, carrying what looked like a body, and then I saw all the surrounding windows go dead one-by-one..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's when I understood -- I shou..."
links.text: "That's when I understood -- I should not be seeing this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods to you. "That l..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods to you. "That lines up with *previous testimony*, doesn't it? Well done, detective."

links.title: You: ""Who were 'they'? Can you describe..."
links.text: "Who were 'they'? Can you describe them?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I couldn't see their faces well, a..."
links.text: "I couldn't see their faces well, and there were quite a few of them. But they were very loud and very... Martinaise..." He pauses, looking for the right wording.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Let's just say that the labouring..."
links.text: "Let's just say that the labouring classes can get rather *expressive* with their profanities."

links.title: You: ""How many of them were there?""
links.text: "How many of them were there?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I couldn't tell you exactly. Less..."
links.text: "I couldn't tell you exactly. Less than ten. Maybe eight?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sends you a sharp lo..."
links.text: The lieutenant sends you a sharp look at the mention of that number.

links.title: You: ""Were any of them huge? Like 200 ki..."
links.text: "Were any of them huge? Like 200 kilograms huge?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's a giant you're describing...."
links.text: "That's a giant you're describing. No, they were all *quite* human, so far as I could tell."

links.title: You: ""Did any of them look like drummers?""
links.text: "Did any of them look like drummers?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Drummers? Why... no... but then, I..."
links.text: "Drummers? Why... no... but then, I don't know what a drummer is *supposed* to look like."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think we can drop the drummer-an..."
links.text: "I think we can drop the drummer-angle," the lieutenant says impatiently. "That was my bad."

links.title: You: ""What happened next?""
links.text: "What happened next?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Sound familiar? That matches the pr..."
links.text: Sound familiar? That matches the prints you observed at the scene.

links.title: You: ""What happened next?" (Proceed.)"
links.text: "What happened next?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I went back inside.""
links.text: "I went back inside."

links.title: Half Light: "Yes, back inside. Keep yourself saf..."
links.text: Yes, back inside. Keep yourself safe from the killing.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Were you able to see anything from..."
links.text: "Were you able to see anything from inside?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer, the yard was pitch black...."
links.text: "Officer, the yard was pitch black. There was nothing to see. But I could still hear their voices. They were threatening to kill that poor man."

links.title: You: ""Were they men, women?""
links.text: "Were they men, women?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""All men, I presume. But again, I c..."
links.text: "All men, I presume. But again, I couldn't see very clearly."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm. But we're fairly certain the..."
links.text: "Hmmm. But we're fairly certain the lady driver was present..." The lieutenant flips through his notes.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure at least *one* of the..."
links.text: "Are you sure at least *one* of them wasn't a woman?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's possible, officer, but I cann..."
links.text: "It's possible, officer, but I cannot say with certainty. It was very dark, you must remember."

links.title: Logic: "That doesn't quite comport with wha..."
links.text: That doesn't quite comport with what you know. Don't forget the lady driver!

links.title: You: ""What ethnicity were they?""
links.text: "What ethnicity were they?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Those funny... Oh." He blinks. "Of..."
links.text: "Those funny... Oh." He blinks. "Officer, that kind of language is unbecoming of an officer of the RCM..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I believe they were mostly white,..."
links.text: "I believe they were mostly white, though I believe I saw two Areopagites among them. And I am quite certain that one spoke with a Mesque accent."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Two Areopagites and a Mesque -- cou..."
links.text: Two Areopagites and a Mesque -- could be Eugene, Theo, and Alain.

links.title: You: ""What happened next?" (Proceed.)"
links.text: "What happened next?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, that's the strangest part, o..."
links.text: "Well, that's the strangest part, officer. *Nothing* happened. It was oddly quiet for a public lynching."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, the novelty dicemaker also me..."
links.text: "Hmm, the novelty dicemaker also mentioned that she didn't hear any signs of a struggle."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Eventually their shouts died down,..."
links.text: "Eventually their shouts died down, and that was all. There were no gunshots, no celebratory shouts, no anything."

links.title: You: ""Why didn't you call the RCM?""
links.text: "Why didn't you call the RCM?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man wipes his glasses. "You're..."
links.text: The man wipes his glasses. "You're right, of course. That is what one is supposed to do in such circumstances. I was simply in shock..."

links.title: You: ""You're right, that does seem stran..."
links.text: "You're right, that does seem strange."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm afraid I don't have anything e..."
links.text: "I'm afraid I don't have anything else to add."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""About what time was all this happe..."
links.text: "About what time was all this happening, approximately?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""All I can say is that it was late.""
links.text: "All I can say is that it was late."

links.title: You: ""You didn't check your watch?""
links.text: "You didn't check your watch?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My watch..." He looks at his watch..."
links.text: "My watch..." He looks at his watch, as though noticing it for the first time. "Yes, now I remember -- it was thirty minutes past midnight, give or take."

links.title: You: ""So let me get this straight. You d..."
links.text: "So let me get this straight. You didn't actually witness the hanging itself, did you?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, I didn't see the corpse until..."
links.text: "No, I didn't see the corpse until the following day."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It seems this wasn't the 'break' y..."
links.text: "It seems this wasn't the 'break' you were hoping for..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think we have everything we need..."
links.text: "I think we have everything we need," the lieutenant says, closing his notebook. "Thank you for talking to us, Mr. Villedrouin."

links.title: You: ""Well, that was a waste of time.""
links.text: "Well, that was a waste of time."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm sorry I couldn't be of more as..."
links.text: "I'm sorry I couldn't be of more assistance."

links.title: You: ""Those are all my questions. Thanks..."
links.text: "Those are all my questions. Thanks for your time."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Of course, anything I can do to as..."
links.text: "Of course, anything I can do to assist the RCM."

links.title: You: ""Can you at least tell me when it h..."
links.text: "Can you at least tell me when it happened?"

links.title: Logic: "That comports with the dicemaker's..."
links.text: That comports with the dicemaker's testimony as well.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean 'nothing happened..."
links.text: "What do you mean 'nothing happened'? They lynched a guy!"

links.title: You: ""Wait, so you didn't actually *see*..."
links.text: "Wait, so you didn't actually *see* the lynching happen?"

links.title: You: ""Thank you, sir. I think we've got..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir. I think we've got the picture. Anything else stand out?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Only that there were about eight o..."
links.text: "Only that there were about eight or ten -- I couldn't make out anything, it was so dark -- and that it was *quiet*," he says, smoothing his hair. "Quietest lynching I ever *heard of*, let alone heard..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But I suspect you knew that alread..."
links.text: "But I suspect you knew that already. I can't say I'm surprised. The fine reputation of the men and women serving in the RCM is well deserved."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sounds like the victim *was* uncon..."
links.text: "Sounds like the victim *was* unconscious. Or at least incapacitated. Well done, detective." He nods to you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sounds like the victim was unconsc..."
links.text: "Sounds like the victim was unconscious. Or at least incapacitated. Interesting."

links.title: You: ""Meaning it was entertaining?""
links.text: "Meaning it was entertaining?"

links.title: You: ""Meaning it was terrifying?""
links.text: "Meaning it was terrifying?"

links.title: You: ""What's an official like you doing..."
links.text: "What's an official like you doing in Martinaise?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The Coalition is only looking out..."
links.text: "The Coalition is only looking out for *ze price stabilité*." He raises an index finger. "Inflation is a killer, like a heart disease blocking the normal circulation of the economy -- It must be controlled..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The economy impacts the entire *in..."
links.text: "The economy impacts the entire *international community*, which is why it requires international oversight."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what are you doing *here..."
links.text: "Okay, but what are you doing *here* in this apartment?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, well, I'm renovating it. It is..."
links.text: "Ah, well, I'm renovating it. It is an interesting project. The building used to be a twelve-story skyscraper before the cannons took the top four stories off. This of course happened when the Coalition forces landed here..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "He smiles. "You could say I'm undoi..."
links.text: He smiles. "You could say I'm undoing some of the *material* damage the international community caused when we arrived here."

links.title: You: ""So you're some kind of bureaucrat?""
links.text: "So you're some kind of bureaucrat?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Yes. As I said before, I'm a commi..."
links.text: "Yes. As I said before, I'm a commissioner from Sur-la-Clef working for the Institute of Price Stabilité." He glances at his watch. "This is one of the main projects of the Moralintern."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Wait, there isn't actually an *Inst..."
links.text: Wait, there isn't actually an *Institute of Price Stabilité*, is there? Or maybe there is... God, it's impossible to understand whether someone from the Moralintern is joking or not.

links.title: You: ""What is this *international commun..."
links.text: "What is this *international community*?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""La communauté internationale is wh..."
links.text: "La communauté internationale is what Revacholians colloquially call *the Coalition*. In other words, the nations that stopped the disaster of the Revolution."

links.title: You: ""And what *do* I call the Coalition?""
links.text: "And what *do* I call the Coalition?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Your employer, technically speakin..."
links.text: "Your employer, technically speaking. The governing authority of Revachol. The RCM is but one part of this provisional administration."

links.title: You: ""What is *ze price stabilité*?""
links.text: "What is *ze price stabilité*?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It is ze most important thing.""
links.text: "It is ze most important thing."

links.title: You: ""That doesn't tell me anything.""
links.text: "That doesn't tell me anything."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's the central goal of any sound..."
links.text: "It's the central goal of any sound monetary policy. Maintaining ze price stabilité is essential to maintaining high levels of economic activity, which is essential for maintaining high levels of employment..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Which is essential for maintaining..."
links.text: "Which is essential for maintaining *ze social stabilité*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Basically it makes sure the price..."
links.text: "Basically it makes sure the price of bread doesn't change."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""*Précisément*! Too much inflation,..."
links.text: "*Précisément*! Too much inflation, bread becomes too expensive; too much deflation, it becomes too cheap for bakers to produce..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's why the Institute of Price..."
links.text: "That's why the Institute of Price Stabilité works to keep inflation just below 2%..."

links.title: You: ""Below 2% of what?""
links.text: "Below 2% of what?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But not *too* far below, no. Too b..."
links.text: "But not *too* far below, no. Too below is also bad -- below, *but close to* 2%."

links.title: You: ""You're not answering my questions..."
links.text: "You're not answering my questions at all."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The Coalition believes in the impo..."
links.text: "The Coalition believes in the importance of informing the public about the benefits of ze price stabilité. Transparency is one of our principles. Would you like an informational pamphlet?"

links.title: You: ""No, I'm good.""
links.text: "No, I'm good."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A sound monetary policy is *essent..."
links.text: "A sound monetary policy is *essential* for addressing *uncertainty*. Stability is the *raison d'être* of the Moralintern. It's the reason why I identify as a moralist."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "He pats his pockets. "But, oh! I do..."
links.text: He pats his pockets. "But, oh! I don't have my leaflets on me today. That's too bad. You can always call our information line. Making information available is part of the Moralintern's commitment to transparency."

links.title: You: ""Okay, sure, give me a leaflet.""
links.text: "Okay, sure, give me a leaflet."

links.title: You: ""This is *fascinating*, but I wante..."
links.text: "This is *fascinating*, but I wanted to ask you something else."

links.title: You: ""How does this benefit us, exactly?""
links.text: "How does this benefit us, exactly?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Take your daily bread, *par exampl..."
links.text: "Take your daily bread, *par example*. Too much inflation, bread becomes too expensive; too much deflation, it becomes too cheap for bakers to produce..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, I think that's all I needed..."
links.text: "Okay, I think that's all I needed to know."

links.title: You: ""Ah, that clears everything up.""
links.text: "Ah, that clears everything up."

links.title: You: ""What's the Moralintern?""
links.text: "What's the Moralintern?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's the international organizatio..."
links.text: "It's the international organization for moralists. Hence 'Moralist International.' The Institute of Price Stability is just one of its many *mind babies* -- as is the Coalition."

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "So when I said I wa..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "So when I said I was a lackey of capital, what I should have said is that I'm a Moralintern bitch?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Doing one's job doesn't automatica..."
links.text: "Doing one's job doesn't automatically make one anyone's *bitch*. Besides, there are more nefarious powers to work for than the Moralintern."

links.title: You: "(Turn back to Sunday Friend.) "Are..."
links.text: (Turn back to Sunday Friend.) "Are you a moralist?"

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "So when I said I wa..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "So when I said I was a thrall to foreign interests, what I should have said is that I'm a Moralintern bitch?"

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "So what I'm hearing..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "So what I'm hearing is that we're Moralintern bitches?"

links.title: You: ""Oooh..." (Turn to Kim.) "So we're..."
links.text: "Oooh..." (Turn to Kim.) "So we're actually working for the Moralintern? That doesn't seem so bad."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "There are more nefarious..."
links.text: He nods. "There are more nefarious powers to work for than the Moralintern."

links.title: You: ""Are you a moralist?""
links.text: "Are you a moralist?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But of course!""
links.text: "But of course!"

links.title: You: ""But why?""
links.text: "But why?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Because moralists believe in a nor..."
links.text: "Because moralists believe in a normal, stable world governed by democratic values."

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "Lieutenant, are *yo..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "Lieutenant, are *you* a moralist?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, me? I... uh...""
links.text: "Hmm, me? I... uh..."

links.title: Composure: "You've managed to catch the lieuten..."
links.text: You've managed to catch the lieutenant off guard, but only for a moment. He quickly recomposes himself.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm a lieutenant of the RCM, dedic..."
links.text: "I'm a lieutenant of the RCM, dedicated to maintaining law and order in Revachol."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A very moralist answer," the man n..."
links.text: "A very moralist answer," the man nods.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is practised in the..."
links.text: The lieutenant is practised in the art of putting on a show for one's superiors.

links.title: You: ""But what is a normal, stable world?""
links.text: "But what is a normal, stable world?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The Occident is part of the normal..."
links.text: "The Occident is part of the normal world. Oranje, Sur-la-Clef..."

links.title: You: ""Martinaise doesn't seem very norma..."
links.text: "Martinaise doesn't seem very normal, or stable, to me."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Martinaise? No, Martinaise is... s..."
links.text: "Martinaise? No, Martinaise is... something else."

links.title: You: ""What about the rest of Revachol? I..."
links.text: "What about the rest of Revachol? Is it part of the normal world?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Revachol is generally... difficult..."
links.text: "Revachol is generally... difficult. It's led by an interim government, which means it hasn't yet achieved *full* democracy..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But they are working towards it! Y..."
links.text: "But they are working towards it! You're all doing very well here, relatively speaking." He gives you an approving nod.

links.title: You: ""I don't think I'm a moralist. Mora..."
links.text: "I don't think I'm a moralist. Moralism sounds incredibly boring. I want more action."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Do you think *peace* is boring? Wh..."
links.text: "Do you think *peace* is boring? What about *prosperity*?"

links.title: You: ""No, peace sounds pretty good.""
links.text: "No, peace sounds pretty good."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Exactly. *I* don't find it boring,..."
links.text: "Exactly. *I* don't find it boring, I find it *fulfilling*. Peace is what allows me to have my morning coffee, my afternoon golf, my sundown friends."

links.title: Rhetoric: "The smile he gives you is straight..."
links.text: The smile he gives you is straight off a campaign poster, the kind of smile focus group-tested to appeal to the most gullible swathe of the electorate.

links.title: You: ""No, prosperity sounds like a lot o..."
links.text: "No, prosperity sounds like a lot of fun."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I agree. And we as an internationa..."
links.text: "I agree. And we as an international community should strive to bring this prosperity to every kid on every isola."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, that shit sounds like a snoo..."
links.text: "Yeah, that shit sounds like a snooze-fest."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My friend, that is only because yo..."
links.text: "My friend, that is only because you have never known the *alternative*. And I pray you never do."

links.title: You: ""Moralism is the ideology of foreig..."
links.text: "Moralism is the ideology of foreign occupiers. Revachol must be governed by Revacholians!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat. "..."
links.text: The lieutenant clears his throat. "Of course, the detective's personal views do not represent the views of the RCM."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Your full autonomy is important, I..."
links.text: "Your full autonomy is important, I agree. But it's an ongoing process. Nothing happens overnight."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now, enough of this delightful pol..."
links.text: "Now, enough of this delightful political interlude. Was there anything else you wanted to ask?"

links.title: You: ""Democracy is a meaningless sham as..."
links.text: "Democracy is a meaningless sham as long as the working class is under the boot-heel of Capital."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat. "..."
links.text: The lieutenant clears his throat. "Of course, the detective's personal views do not represent the views of the RCM."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, my friend, but the lesson of t..."
links.text: "Ah, my friend, but the lesson of the Revolution is that communism does not work."

links.title: You: ""It 'didn't work' because the Coali..."
links.text: "It 'didn't work' because the Coalition crushed it violently."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh, yes, the big bad Coalition cru..."
links.text: "Oh, yes, the big bad Coalition crushed the Revolution. Tell me, if the revolution was succeeding, would it have been crushed so easily?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Are we really so bad for wanting c..."
links.text: "Are we really so bad for wanting compromise, peace, and prosperity -- on reasonable, achievable terms? Ask yourself that."

links.title: You: ""We just haven't tried *real* commu..."
links.text: "We just haven't tried *real* communism yet."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, yes, the unattainable ideal. N..."
links.text: "Ah, yes, the unattainable ideal. Never settle for less! Good luck with that, my friend."

links.title: Volition: "It's not like you're going to gathe..."
links.text: It's not like you're going to gather any forces soon with all that drinking -- and he knows it.

links.title: You: ""And you're telling me *this* world..."
links.text: "And you're telling me *this* world here is working out well?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's moving towards the right dire..."
links.text: "It's moving towards the right direction and that's all that matters. Progress is measured in centimetres, my friend."

links.title: You: ""It's like every time I'm talking t..."
links.text: "It's like every time I'm talking to people I'm choosing Option D, 'none of the above'... Is that moralism?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Is this 'Option D' usually the mos..."
links.text: "Is this 'Option D' usually the most *reasonable* answer?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, everything else is super extr..."
links.text: "Yes, everything else is super extreme. It's like I'm living with a bunch of lunatics..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Sounds like you're a moralist inde..."
links.text: "Sounds like you're a moralist indeed, my friend. Welcome."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Moralism is all about compromise a..."
links.text: "Moralism is all about compromise and achieving the achievable. It's pragmatic, realistic, and level-headed, an ideology for *doers*. Are you a doer, my friend? It looks to me like you are."

links.title: You: ""It's usually the most boring one.""
links.text: "It's usually the most boring one."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Not boring, my friend. *Responsibl..."
links.text: "Not boring, my friend. *Responsible*."

links.title: You: ""Am *I* a moralist?""
links.text: "Am *I* a moralist?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, do you value freedom? Do you..."
links.text: "Well, do you value freedom? Do you believe in a normal, stable world governed by democratic values?"

links.title: You: ""Tell me about Sur-la-Clef.""
links.text: "Tell me about Sur-la-Clef."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What's there to say? Sur-la-Clef i..."
links.text: "What's there to say? Sur-la-Clef is a modern, urbanized country that measures very high on the Human Development and Freedom Index. Mostly, though, it's known as the executive heart of *EPIS*..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Moreover, it is a great sponsor of..."
links.text: "Moreover, it is a great sponsor of less-emerged countries. Revachol is only one of its many darlings whose progress it supports and cherishes."

links.title: Rhetoric: "*Darlings*? That can't be an offici..."
links.text: *Darlings*? That can't be an official designation.

links.title: You: ""What makes Revachol Sur-la-Clef's..."
links.text: "What makes Revachol Sur-la-Clef's 'darling'?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Because a great percentage of Reva..."
links.text: "Because a great percentage of Revachol's culture hails from Sur-la-Clef -- its language, its people, its cuisine even, or at least in the downtown La Delta area."

links.title: Perception (Taste): "Jamrock and other parts of the Inte..."
links.text: Jamrock and other parts of the International Zone have been mercifully spared of Sur-la-Clef's love for meatballs and mashed potatoes.

links.title: You: ""That's nice of them.""
links.text: "That's nice of them."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh, yes. Sur-la-Clef is *mega-bene..."
links.text: "Oh, yes. Sur-la-Clef is *mega-benevolent* to its darlings."

links.title: Half Light: "What is it about this 'benevolence'..."
links.text: What is it about this 'benevolence' that makes you break out in sweat and want to run for the hills?

links.title: You: ""Tell me about Oranje.""
links.text: "Tell me about Oranje."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oranje is an *exemplary* nation wh..."
links.text: "Oranje is an *exemplary* nation who, as a core member of EPIS, contributes 28% of our annual budget. Next to Sur-la-Clef, Oranje is probably the most prominent member of the international community."

links.title: You: ""Which one of them is more EPIS?""
links.text: "Which one of them is more EPIS?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""As founding members they are *both..."
links.text: "As founding members they are *both* very EPIS. Oranje carries a lot of political weight, while Sur-la-Clef takes care of the business side of things -- Sur-la-Clef hosts the headquarters of the major EPIS institutions."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but outside of EPIS, what is..."
links.text: "Okay, but outside of EPIS, what is Oranje?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oranje's economy is one of the mos..."
links.text: "Oranje's economy is one of the most advanced in the world. It has successfully transitioned from heavy industry to advanced services, and generally acts as an engine for sustainable change in the international community."

links.title: Rhetoric: "But that didn't tell you anything a..."
links.text: But that didn't tell you anything about Oranje.

links.title: You: ""I once heard from *here* that they..."
links.text: "I once heard from *here* that they are a reasonably sized superpower." (Tap your head.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's one way to put it, yes. The..."
links.text: "That's one way to put it, yes. They certainly have the power to exert influence over others, but they only do it in the name of regional stability. After all, Oranje is a Moralintern nation, not some crazed Mesque petro-fascist state."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "If he knows so much about Oranje, m..."
links.text: If he knows so much about Oranje, maybe he also knows about Oranjese mercenaries?

links.title: You: ""Can't you just... talk like a norm..."
links.text: "Can't you just... talk like a normal person?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""About what?""
links.text: "About what?"

links.title: You: ""About Oranje -- just tell me what..."
links.text: "About Oranje -- just tell me what it's like there."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh, it's very urban and very well-..."
links.text: "Oh, it's very urban and very well-organized. Their streets are clean, their horsecars run on time, the people are polite and efficient. Like I said, they are an example for less-emerged nations to follow."

links.title: You: ""Enough business, let's talk about..."
links.text: "Enough business, let's talk about something else."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Whatever you wish, officer.""
links.text: "Whatever you wish, officer."

links.title: You: ""What if I told you there's a fugit..."
links.text: "What if I told you there's a fugitive from the Moralintern in Martinaise?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A *fugitive*?""
links.text: "A *fugitive*?"

links.title: Drama: "Hypothetically sssspeaking, you mig..."
links.text: Hypothetically sssspeaking, you might add.

links.title: You: ""...hypothetically speaking.""
links.text: "...hypothetically speaking."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, I would say that is very bad..."
links.text: "Well, I would say that is very bad, indeed. Not super."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What sort of a fugitive are we tal..."
links.text: "What sort of a fugitive are we talking about here?"

links.title: You: ""Pretty serious, like corporate esp..."
links.text: "Pretty serious, like corporate espionage-type stuff."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That is *extremely serious*!""
links.text: "That is *extremely serious*!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Corporate espionage may technicall..."
links.text: "Corporate espionage may technically be legal in *Revachol*, but elsewhere it's a very high-level offence. It violates a number of international agreements, in particular the First La Cherte Accord..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""This fugitive must be turned over..."
links.text: "This fugitive must be turned over to the ICP immediately. Have you apprehended them already?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A moment, if you don't mind, sir."..."
links.text: "A moment, if you don't mind, sir." The lieutenant pulls you aside.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do realize what you're doing,..."
links.text: "You do realize what you're doing, don't you?" He whispers to you, *sotto voce*.

links.title: Authority: "Of course, you're turning over a da..."
links.text: Of course, you're turning over a dangerous LAWBREAKER.

links.title: Empathy: "You're dooming a young woman in her..."
links.text: You're dooming a young woman in her hour of desperation.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm turning over a dangerous..."
links.text: "Yeah, I'm turning over a dangerous fugitive."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks you straight i..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks you straight in the eye, trying to gauge your seriousness.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I won't tell you how to do your jo..."
links.text: "I won't tell you how to do your job. But remember, this is an RCM matter. Make sure you weigh your next words carefully."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He won't tell you how to do your jo..."
links.text: He won't tell you how to do your job, but a good police officer knows when to listen to his partner.

links.title: Sunday Friend: "When you turn back the man is looki..."
links.text: When you turn back the man is looking at you expectantly.

links.title: You: ""Oh, shit, Klaasje could really get..."
links.text: "Oh, shit, Klaasje could really get in real trouble if I tell him about her, huh?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Very* real trouble...""
links.text: "*Very* real trouble..."

links.title: Empathy: "Stop! Before you do anything, consi..."
links.text: Stop! Before you do anything, consider the consequences.

links.title: You: "What do you mean?"
links.text: What do you mean?

links.title: Empathy: "Have you thought about what this mi..."
links.text: Have you thought about what this might mean for Klaasje?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Turn her in now and you'll never ge..."
links.text: Turn her in now and you'll never get the chance to feel her sweet young flesh against yours.

links.title: Authority: "Don't concern yourself with the fee..."
links.text: Don't concern yourself with the feelings of a LAWBREAKER.

links.title: You: "Oh, right. She could get in big tro..."
links.text: Oh, right. She could get in big trouble if I turn her over to the ICP.

links.title: Empathy: "It's your call."
links.text: It's your call.

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man looks at you expectantly."
links.text: The man looks at you expectantly.

links.title: You: "What happens to her is no business..."
links.text: What happens to her is no business of mine.

links.title: You: "Consequences? I don't care about co..."
links.text: Consequences? I don't care about consequences!

links.title: Empathy: "Do you not care for anyone other th..."
links.text: Do you not care for anyone other than yourself? Have you thought about what this might mean for Klaasje?

links.title: You: ""Her name is Klaasje and she's alre..."
links.text: "Her name is Klaasje and she's already in police custody."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, good to hear. Excellent. On be..."
links.text: "Ah, good to hear. Excellent. On behalf of the Moralintern, let me thank you for this service..."

links.title: Empathy: "That's it. She's done for. Au revoi..."
links.text: That's it. She's done for. Au revoir, Klaasje.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant does his level best..."
links.text: The lieutenant does his level best to suppress a deep sigh.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""This is a great relief. The sancti..."
links.text: "This is a great relief. The sanctity of corporate secrets is a cornerstone of the international order..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'll be sure I make a note of your..."
links.text: "I'll be sure I make a note of your contributions in my report. Revachol is fortunate to have police officers like you."

links.title: You: ""You hear that Kim? Revachol's luck..."
links.text: "You hear that Kim? Revachol's lucky to have me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suspect he doesn't know the half..."
links.text: "I suspect he doesn't know the half of it."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now that that's settled, was there..."
links.text: "Now that that's settled, was there anything else you'd like to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""Just doing my job, sir.""
links.text: "Just doing my job, sir."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man nods. "You are a credit to..."
links.text: The man nods. "You are a credit to the RCM. If more Revacholians were like you, they might be part of EPIS by now."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Somehow the man thinks of this as a..."
links.text: Somehow the man thinks of this as a compliment rather than an expression of patronizing condescension.

links.title: You: ""Honour demanded it.""
links.text: "Honour demanded it."

links.title: You: ""For almighty Revachol.""
links.text: "For almighty Revachol."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What was that?""
links.text: "What was that?"

links.title: You: ""I said 'For almighty Revachol' you..."
links.text: "I said 'For almighty Revachol' you deaf frog-eater."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What the detective means is that h..."
links.text: "What the detective means is that he's proud to serve the RCM."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, of course. Carry on then.""
links.text: "Ah, of course. Carry on then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a sharp lo..."
links.text: The lieutenant gives you a sharp look. He's bailed you out, again, but he's none too pleased about it.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Aha," he says, his voice suddenly..."
links.text: "Aha," he says, his voice suddenly cool. "A *nationalist*, I see. In other circumstances I might be compelled to report you for *sedition*..."

links.title: Authority: "He won't, though, because he's noth..."
links.text: He won't, though, because he's nothing but a sissy *bureaucrat*.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, no matter. You've done the M..."
links.text: "Well, no matter. You've done the Moralintern a great service regardless of your *personal* views..."

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Just doing my job.""
links.text: "Nothing. Just doing my job."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, very good, then." Your remark..."
links.text: "Ah, very good, then." Your remark seems to have completely vanished from his mind.

links.title: Authority: "What? Are you intimidated by this s..."
links.text: What? Are you intimidated by this sissy *bureaucrat*? Mediocre!

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now that that's settled, was there..."
links.text: "Now that that's settled, was there anything else you'd like to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""Her name is Klaasje and she's at t..."
links.text: "Her name is Klaasje and she's at the Whirling-in-Rags."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Right. That should be enough for t..."
links.text: "Right. That should be enough for the ICP. Very good. On behalf of the Moralintern, let me thank you for this service..."

links.title: You: ""I meant that as a hypothetical. I..."
links.text: "I meant that as a hypothetical. I don't actually know about any corporate espionage."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, that's right. You did say this..."
links.text: "Ah, that's right. You did say this was all just a *hypothetical* scenario..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Whew! For a moment there I was con..."
links.text: "Whew! For a moment there I was concerned that we had *quite* the situation on our hands..."

links.title: Drama: "A bullet deftly dodged, ssssire."
links.text: A bullet deftly dodged, ssssire.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now that that's settled, was there..."
links.text: "Now that that's settled, was there anything else you'd like to discuss?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What do you mean 'as a hypothetica..."
links.text: "What do you mean 'as a hypothetical'? I don't mean to imply anything, officer, but there's no chance you're *harbouring* a fugitive, is there?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You should have heeded your partner..."
links.text: You should have heeded your partner's warning. Now it's too late.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm afraid I must *insist* that yo..."
links.text: "I'm afraid I must *insist* that you tell me what you know. Or I'll be forced to make a *very* unfavourable report to my superiors at the Moralintern."

links.title: You: "Pin it on someone else."
links.text: Pin it on someone else.

links.title: Drama: "Now's your chance, ssssire. Which o..."
links.text: Now's your chance, ssssire. Which of your enemies would you most like to make trouble for?

links.title: You: ""It's Evrart Claire, the head of th..."
links.text: "It's Evrart Claire, the head of the Dockworkers' Union."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Evrart Claire? Surely you're mista..."
links.text: "Evrart Claire? Surely you're mistaken."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean? Have you *met* E..."
links.text: "What do you mean? Have you *met* Evrart?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I *have*. The only thing Evrart is..."
links.text: "I *have*. The only thing Evrart is a fugitive from is the *exercise machine*..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Besides, in certain less-advanced..."
links.text: "Besides, in certain less-advanced nations the Moralintern may defer to local custom..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "'Customs' like blatant, systematic..."
links.text: 'Customs' like blatant, systematic corruption?

links.title: Authority: "'Customs' like complete disregard f..."
links.text: 'Customs' like complete disregard for the *Rule of Law*?

links.title: You: ""He's already planning to go to war..."
links.text: "He's already planning to go to war with Wild Pines. It's definitely the kind of thing he'd do."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, no, no. Evrart would have no n..."
links.text: "No, no, no. Evrart would have no need to dirty his hands in such a way..."

links.title: You: ""His name is Garte, and he's workin..."
links.text: "His name is Garte, and he's working at the Whirling-in-Rags disguised as a cafeteria manager."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A cafeteria manager, you say? How..."
links.text: "A cafeteria manager, you say? How strange. Normally fugitives don't take on such *public* roles."

links.title: You: ""He's extremely clever like that. C..."
links.text: "He's extremely clever like that. Careful, though, he'll also try to convince you that you owe him money."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Much as I'm inclined to believe yo..."
links.text: "Much as I'm inclined to believe you, I'm not sure my colleagues at the ICP will..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'll make note of your claims in m..."
links.text: "I'll make note of your claims in my report, but I'm sorry to say it's likely to end up in the back of a filing cabinet somewhere in Mirova, unread and forgotten."

links.title: You: ""That's a shame.""
links.text: "That's a shame."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Yes, it rather is. As much as I'm..."
links.text: "Yes, it rather is. As much as I'm a true believer in international institutions, there are times when even I grow frustrated with the bureaucracy..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, no matter. I should thank yo..."
links.text: "Well, no matter. I should thank you for bringing this to our attention. Your efforts have been noted."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now, was there anything else you w..."
links.text: "Now, was there anything else you wanted to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""That's totally fine.""
links.text: "That's totally fine."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You think it's 'fine' that Martina..."
links.text: "You think it's 'fine' that Martinaise is a safe haven for international fugitives? You know, concern for the rule of law is one of the Moralintern's main criteria for admission into EPIS..."

links.title: You: ""For some reason he gives you a dis..."
links.text: "For some reason he gives you a discount if you trash the cafeteria."

links.title: You: ""You'll find him hanging out by the..."
links.text: "You'll find him hanging out by the roundabout. He's disguised as a really racist lorry driver."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""As a common lorry driver, you say?..."
links.text: "As a common lorry driver, you say? Interesting. Are you sure?"

links.title: You: ""He'll tell you his name is Raphael..."
links.text: "He'll tell you his name is Raphael, but his real name is Herve, so make sure you call him that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant makes a strange soun..."
links.text: The lieutenant makes a strange sound that he quickly smothers.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Was that... did the lieutenant just..."
links.text: Was that... did the lieutenant just *snort*?

links.title: You: ""He may not look like an corporate..."
links.text: "He may not look like an corporate spy, but that's what makes him so effective."

links.title: You: ""There are a bunch of speedfreaks l..."
links.text: "There are a bunch of speedfreaks lurking around the church. They confessed while high on drugs."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A drug-addled *spy-ring*! That sou..."
links.text: "A drug-addled *spy-ring*! That sounds rather *strange*, don't you think?"

links.title: You: ""Not nearly as strange as the anodi..."
links.text: "Not nearly as strange as the anodic dance music they're into."

links.title: You: ""Drugs make people do *crazy* thing..."
links.text: "Drugs make people do *crazy* things sometimes, like steal corporate secrets."

links.title: Drama: "What about that gremlin child from..."
links.text: What about that gremlin child from behind the Whirling-in-Ragssss?

links.title: You: ""There's this ugly-ass kid who hang..."
links.text: "There's this ugly-ass kid who hangs out behind the Whirling-in-Rags. He's your guy."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A what... a *child*?" He seems con..."
links.text: "A what... a *child*?" He seems confused at first, then disappointed.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What proof do you have that this *..."
links.text: "What proof do you have that this *child* is involved in corporate espionage?"

links.title: You: ""His dad's a major drug kingpin in..."
links.text: "His dad's a major drug kingpin in Martinaise."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Selling drugs is certainly unfortu..."
links.text: "Selling drugs is certainly unfortunate, but what does that have to do with corporate espionage?"

links.title: You: ""I'm saying it establishes a *patte..."
links.text: "I'm saying it establishes a *pattern* of criminality. Do I need to get a cork board and some yarn here?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""There's no way I can submit this r..."
links.text: "There's no way I can submit this report to the ICP -- they'd have my head examined!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I suggest you work on your *invest..."
links.text: "I suggest you work on your *investigative skills* a bit more before you go around accusing children of crimes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, sir. I'll be sure to..."
links.text: "You're right, sir. I'll be sure to give the detective an overview of proper police procedure." The lieutenant darts a quick glance in your direction.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That was a wink. Your good cop/idio..."
links.text: That was a wink. Your good cop/idiot cop routine seems to have done the trick.

links.title: Empathy: "Well, that wasn't pretty, but you d..."
links.text: Well, that wasn't pretty, but you do seem to have taken the heat off Klaasje, for now.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now that that's settled, was there..."
links.text: "Now that that's settled, was there anything else you'd like to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""It's a slippery slope, man..." (Ma..."
links.text: "It's a slippery slope, man..." (Make a sliding gesture with your hand.) "Real slippery."

links.title: You: ""Hmm, that does seem kinda *tenuous..."
links.text: "Hmm, that does seem kinda *tenuous* now that you mention it."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""*Extremely* tenuous...""
links.text: "*Extremely* tenuous..."

links.title: You: ""He's been stealing locusts from so..."
links.text: "He's been stealing locusts from some cryptozoologists."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Stealing from misguided pseudo-sci..."
links.text: "Stealing from misguided pseudo-scientists is unfortunate, but what does that have to do with corporate espionage?"

links.title: You: ""He used reactionary slurs on my cr..."
links.text: "He used reactionary slurs on my crime scene."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Tsk-tsk. Racial slurs certainly ha..."
links.text: "Tsk-tsk. Racial slurs certainly have no place in a pluralistic society, but what does that have to do with corporate espionage?"

links.title: You: ""He's been throwing rocks at a corp..."
links.text: "He's been throwing rocks at a corpse."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Corpse desecration is morally repu..."
links.text: "Corpse desecration is morally repugnant, but what does that have to do with corporate espionage?"

links.title: You: ""He's a ginger. What else do you ne..."
links.text: "He's a ginger. What else do you need to know?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What do you mean by that, officer?""
links.text: "What do you mean by that, officer?"

links.title: You: ""I'm still looking for the fugitive..."
links.text: "I'm still looking for the fugitive. I'll report back if I learn anything more."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I understand that you're here to i..."
links.text: "I understand that you're here to investigate a *murder*," the man says, his face grave, "but I must impress upon you the *seriousness* of this matter..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""*Thousands* of corporate secrets m..."
links.text: "*Thousands* of corporate secrets may be at stake here. I shudder to think what damage that might do to the international markets..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's certainly serious, sir. But t..."
links.text: "It's certainly serious, sir. But there's also the question of jurisdiction. The Wayfarer Act places certain *strictures* on what matters the RCM may involve itself in."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You're right, of course. What use..."
links.text: "You're right, of course. What use are protocols if you don't follow them?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man sighs. "I only pray that th..."
links.text: The man sighs. "I only pray that the ICP apprehends this fugitive before more corporate secrets are lost..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now, was there anything else you w..."
links.text: "Now, was there anything else you wished to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""I think they may have broken into..."
links.text: "I think they may have broken into some places."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Hmmm, that could be *quite* bad, d..."
links.text: "Hmmm, that could be *quite* bad, depending on what sort of place you're talking about."

links.title: You: ""What if I told you it was the inte..."
links.text: "What if I told you it was the international headquarters of a major corporation?"

links.title: You: ""Probably like a Frittte or somethi..."
links.text: "Probably like a Frittte or something."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, well. Burglary is a serious vi..."
links.text: "Ah, well. Burglary is a serious violation of the right to property, but it is a *local* matter. Thus, the Moralintern need not get involved."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Now, was there something else you..."
links.text: "Now, was there something else you wanted to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I saw them litteri..."
links.text: "I'm pretty sure I saw them littering."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh! Hahaha. A good joke. Very funn..."
links.text: "Oh! Hahaha. A good joke. Very funny. Littering is of course a local offence that need not concern the Moralintern."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I think it was way worse..."
links.text: "Actually, I think it was way worse than that. Like, corporate espionage."

links.title: You: ""Cool. I guess we'll handle it from..."
links.text: "Cool. I guess we'll handle it from here."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Very good. Now was there anything..."
links.text: "Very good. Now was there anything else you'd like to discuss?"

links.title: You: ""The man who was lynched outside yo..."
links.text: "The man who was lynched outside your window was from Oranje."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh? That's unusual. The Oranjese a..."
links.text: "Oh? That's unusual. The Oranjese are not the kind of people you associate with heinous crimes. It's such an upstanding and responsible country..."

links.title: You: ""That's not how I would describe th..."
links.text: "That's not how I would describe this guy."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well certainly one cannot rely sim..."
links.text: "Well certainly one cannot rely simply on generalizations -- that would go against our commitment to individual freedoms..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""And, of course, any loss of life i..."
links.text: "And, of course, any loss of life is a tragedy." The man seems to observe a moment of silence. "So tell me, what have you learned about the victim?"

links.title: You: ""He was a mercenary.""
links.text: "He was a mercenary."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Aha, a *condottiere*," the man say..."
links.text: "Aha, a *condottiere*," the man says, as though describing a character from a fantasy novel. "Yes, it's hard to believe they still exist."

links.title: You: ""His name was Lely.""
links.text: "His name was Lely."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Lely? That's an interesting name.""
links.text: "Lely? That's an interesting name."

links.title: You: ""Lely wasn't his real name. It was..."
links.text: "Lely wasn't his real name. It was a *nom de guerre*."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, he was a soldier?""
links.text: "Ah, he was a soldier?"

links.title: You: ""A mercenary.""
links.text: "A mercenary."

links.title: You: ""His name's not really important. W..."
links.text: "His name's not really important. What matters is that he was a mercenary."

links.title: You: ""His name was Ellis Kortenaer.""
links.text: "His name was Ellis Kortenaer."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ellis Kortenaer? That's an interes..."
links.text: "Ellis Kortenaer? That's an interesting name."

links.title: You: ""He was a motherfucker and a killer.""
links.text: "He was a motherfucker and a killer."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer, you shouldn't speak ill o..."
links.text: "Officer, you shouldn't speak ill of the dead!"

links.title: You: ""It's okay, he told me so.""
links.text: "It's okay, he told me so."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""He... so you spoke with the victim..."
links.text: "He... so you spoke with the victim *before* he died?"

links.title: You: ""No, this was after he died.""
links.text: "No, this was after he died."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man gives the lieutenant a nerv..."
links.text: The man gives the lieutenant a nervous look.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant raises his eyebrows..."
links.text: The lieutenant raises his eyebrows as though he'd stopped paying attention.

links.title: Empathy: "Your partner's doing you a favour b..."
links.text: Your partner's doing you a favour by pretending not to have heard your insane ramblings.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I... see. Well, you must be a very..."
links.text: "I... see. Well, you must be a very thorough detective. So what else did you learn?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, it was a wild coincidence. L..."
links.text: "Yeah, it was a wild coincidence. Let's move on, though."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man seems slightly relieved, as..."
links.text: The man seems slightly relieved, as though he's just narrowly survived a perilous bend in the road.

links.title: You: ""You're right. That was disrespectf..."
links.text: "You're right. That was disrespectful of me."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "He nods. "Anything else?""
links.text: He nods. "Anything else?"

links.title: You: ""He liked to get high and brag abou..."
links.text: "He liked to get high and brag about war crimes he'd committed."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Extremely distasteful behaviour. I..."
links.text: "Extremely distasteful behaviour. I cannot condone either drug use or needless boasting..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Suffice it to say, that is *not* h..."
links.text: "Suffice it to say, that is *not* how we do things in Sur-la-Clef."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "That's because they're all a bunch..."
links.text: That's because they're all a bunch of squares who like to sit around with their fingers up each other's assholes.

links.title: You: ""He was a poor kid before the Oranj..."
links.text: "He was a poor kid before the Oranjese government put him in a military academy."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man nods. "It's the responsibil..."
links.text: The man nods. "It's the responsibility of any good welfare state to take care of its most unfortunate citizens."

links.title: You: ""They turned him into a psychopathi..."
links.text: "They turned him into a psychopathic killing machine!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""They gave him a successful *career..."
links.text: "They gave him a successful *career*." The man holds up a finger as though he's made a brilliant point.

links.title: Half Light: "YES. Killing was his business and b..."
links.text: YES. Killing was his business and business was *good*.

links.title: Empathy: "Did he love it before they made him..."
links.text: Did he love it before they made him do it again and again and again?

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""What else has your investigation u..."
links.text: "What else has your investigation uncovered?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, he should have been grateful..."
links.text: "Yeah, he should have been grateful for the help."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Every one of us has our role to pl..."
links.text: "Every one of us has our role to play."

links.title: You: ""After he was discharged from the m..."
links.text: "After he was discharged from the military he joined a group of mercenaries."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That is extremely unfortunate. Yes..."
links.text: "That is extremely unfortunate. Yes, it's regrettable that this practice has a history in certain Occidental nations, even highly advanced members of EPIS..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But rest assured: The Oranjese gov..."
links.text: "But rest assured: The Oranjese government has committed to producing a timetable that would lay out a path to transition to a professional army. Soon there'll be no need for mercenaries like this poor man."

links.title: You: ""What kind of a timetable are we ta..."
links.text: "What kind of a timetable are we talking about here?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh, it's hard to put an exact date..."
links.text: "Oh, it's hard to put an exact date on it. I believe the proposal for the timetable is due to be completed around '60 or '61."

links.title: You: ""What? That's like a decade from no..."
links.text: "What? That's like a decade from now!"

links.title: You: ""I guess that's better than nothing.""
links.text: "I guess that's better than nothing."

links.title: You: ""Oh, well that solves that, then.""
links.text: "Oh, well that solves that, then."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man nods. "See? That's the kind..."
links.text: The man nods. "See? That's the kind of progress that the Moralintern makes possible."

links.title: You: ""As a merc, he killed a lot of peop..."
links.text: "As a merc, he killed a lot of people on the Semenine Islands to advance Oranjese business interests."

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man shakes his head solemnly. "..."
links.text: The man shakes his head solemnly. "A great shame, yes. Colonialism is a dark spectre in Oranje's past..."

links.title: You: ""Who's talking about the past? It's..."
links.text: "Who's talking about the past? It's still going on!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""...which is *why* the work of the..."
links.text: "...which is *why* the work of the Moralintern is so critical. It is our great bulwark against another century of bloodshed."

links.title: You: "(Shake your head too.) "History is..."
links.text: (Shake your head too.) "History is very complicated and rarely simple."

links.title: You: "(Shrug.) "What's a bunch of dead ki..."
links.text: (Shrug.) "What's a bunch of dead kipts where there's fortune and glory?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A bunch of *what*, detective?""
links.text: "A bunch of *what*, detective?"

links.title: You: ""Kipts. You know.""
links.text: "Kipts. You know."

links.title: You: ""Nothing, sorry.""
links.text: "Nothing, sorry."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Yes, well. As I was saying: Coloni..."
links.text: "Yes, well. As I was saying: Colonialism has left a dark legacy in many places, one we must move past, but also never forget."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer, please! The Moralintern i..."
links.text: "Officer, please! The Moralintern is dedicated to fostering a more tolerant and pluralistic society. There's no room for racial slurs there."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There seems to be plenty of room fo..."
links.text: There seems to be plenty of room for proxy wars waged by multinational corporations, though.

links.title: You: ""That's all. That's who he was.""
links.text: "That's all. That's who he was."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""As I said, the loss of any life is..."
links.text: "As I said, the loss of any life is terrible, no matter who the person may have been..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I do hope you're able to bring his..."
links.text: "I do hope you're able to bring his killer or killers to justice. We must show that the rule of law still applies... even in Revachol."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, that's all I wanted to say.""
links.text: "Yeah, that's all I wanted to say."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Very good. What else then?""
links.text: "Very good. What else then?"

links.title: You: ""Can you tell me about your friend?""
links.text: "Can you tell me about your friend?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My friend, my friend, what about h..."
links.text: "My friend, my friend, what about him?"

links.title: You: ""What's Kedra?""
links.text: "What's Kedra?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Kedra is a candidate member of EPI..."
links.text: "Kedra is a candidate member of EPIS. But, between you and me, their potential membership is a more... *contentious* issue."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That it's never going to happen. T..."
links.text: "That it's never going to happen. They entered negotiations in '21 and it's been pending ever since."

links.title: You: ""What's this EPIS thing you keep ta..."
links.text: "What's this EPIS thing you keep talking about?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""EPIS is a very special program dev..."
links.text: "EPIS is a very special program developed by the Moralintern to support certain Occidental nations. It began as a unified system of weights and measures, which proved to be a *wild* success. Nothing but kilograms and centimetres as far as the eye can see!"

links.title: Logic: "God, yes. Sweet standardisation. Th..."
links.text: God, yes. Sweet standardisation. The backbone of rationality -- and commerce.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It was *such* a wild success that..."
links.text: "It was *such* a wild success that we expanded it into an economic union for the processing of steel -- another success. And between you and me... the Moralintern feels *emboldened* by this success. Emboldened to take EPIS to the next level."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but like, what does it stand..."
links.text: "Okay, but like, what does it stand for?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Why, it stands for progress and st..."
links.text: "Why, it stands for progress and stability, like the Moralintern as a whole."

links.title: You: ""No, what do the *letters* stand fo..."
links.text: "No, what do the *letters* stand for?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's been such a wild, *extraordin..."
links.text: "It's been such a wild, *extraordinary* success thus far. We are very excited to take it to the next level..."

links.title: You: ""You don't even hear the words I'm..."
links.text: "You don't even hear the words I'm saying, do you?"

links.title: You: ""Sure, fine. What's this next level..."
links.text: "Sure, fine. What's this next level you were talking about?"

links.title: You: ""What's on the next level?""
links.text: "What's on the next level?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A supranational political alliance..."
links.text: "A supranational political alliance, the United States of Occident."

links.title: You: ""Is it going to be like this place..."
links.text: "Is it going to be like this place here?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You mean Revachol? No, it's going..."
links.text: "You mean Revachol? No, it's going to have transparent democracy."

links.title: You: ""Is Revachol going to be part of EP..."
links.text: "Is Revachol going to be part of EPIS?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's one day going to be a *candid..."
links.text: "It's one day going to be a *candidate member* of EPIS, sure."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Except that *candidate* members nev..."
links.text: Except that *candidate* members never become *full* members, do they?

links.title: You: ""Didn't you say that candidate memb..."
links.text: "Didn't you say that candidate members never become real members?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, no, candidate members *do* bec..."
links.text: "No, no, candidate members *do* become members, why do we even have the whole system in place if they don't? It just takes time -- time and evaluation."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But we were talking about my frien..."
links.text: "But we were talking about my friend here, not politics..." He chuckles gently.

links.title: You: ""But that doesn't tell me anything..."
links.text: "But that doesn't tell me anything about Kedra itself. Is it warm there? Cold? Something in-between?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's warm," he nods. "It's also kn..."
links.text: "It's warm," he nods. "It's also known for its mandarin trees and dust storms from Supramundi."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Kedra's an emerging market, but it..."
links.text: "Kedra's an emerging market, but it still has a long way to go -- maybe that's why my friend's ménage decided to emigrate."

links.title: You: ""How did you two even become friend..."
links.text: "How did you two even become friends?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""How did any of us become friends?..."
links.text: "How did any of us become friends? Bad things happening on the Insulindian isola. Oil platforms ablaze in the night. Civil wars lasting for years. Finally, the international community is forced to step in."

links.title: You: ""What are you talking about? No one..."
links.text: "What are you talking about? No one becomes friends that way."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Au contraire. It's how millions of..."
links.text: "Au contraire. It's how millions of people end up where they are, meeting the people they meet. It's how I came here, and my friend, too."

links.title: You: ""You're describing how the Coalitio..."
links.text: "You're describing how the Coalition occupied Revachol."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""One of the wonders of democracy is..."
links.text: "One of the wonders of democracy is that everyone is allowed to have his own opinion." The man pats his pockets, looking for something. "And not just allowed, *encouraged* even. Have you ever tried debate?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "There's a joke here, and you know w..."
links.text: There's a joke here, and you know what it is.

links.title: Volition: "C'mon. It's so juvenile. Besides, t..."
links.text: C'mon. It's so juvenile. Besides, there's no way this man is going to get it.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That's why it's good."
links.text: That's why it's good.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm what they call a *master..."
links.text: "Yeah, I'm what they call a *master 'bater*." (Brush some invisible dirt off your shoulder.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh! How wonderful. I've heard it's..."
links.text: "Oh! How wonderful. I've heard it's *oodles* of fun. Not that I have time to take up new hobbies myself..."

links.title: Volition: "See? He didn't get it. Good job, jo..."
links.text: See? He didn't get it. Good job, jokemeister.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant lets out a long, nas..."
links.text: The lieutenant lets out a long, nasal sigh.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Debating. You should consider join..."
links.text: "Debating. You should consider joining a debating society for adults. I hear they're *oodles* of fun. I used to have a flyer for one, but..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But now that I start to think of i..."
links.text: "But now that I start to think of it, it was for an improv class anyway. It's this funny theatre thing, you know," he moves his fingers, "very *creative*, helps relieve stress."

links.title: Conceptualization: "A chill runs down your spine as you..."
links.text: A chill runs down your spine as you envision a half-dozen people in professional attire standing around a chair awkwardly pretending to be waiting for a motor-bus. It's neither funny nor creative.

links.title: You: ""You still haven't told me who he i..."
links.text: "You still haven't told me who he is."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Sorry, who?" The man throws a quic..."
links.text: "Sorry, who?" The man throws a quick glance at his watch.

links.title: You: ""Your friend, Martin Martinaise.""
links.text: "Your friend, Martin Martinaise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, that's not his..." the lieuten..."
links.text: "No, that's not his..." the lieutenant sighs. "Martin Martinaise is a *joke*, a generic nickname for someone from Martinaise."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""And my friend's not even your typi..."
links.text: "And my friend's not even your typical local -- definitely not just another Martin Martinaise or Raoul Revachol. Maybe that's why we're friends."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Martin Martinaise? That's not a na..."
links.text: "Martin Martinaise? That's not a name. Are you referring to my friend? But I told you, he's from Kedra -- definitely not just another Martin Martinaise or Raoul Revachol. Perhaps that's why he and I became friends..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""He's a bright young man here to pu..."
links.text: "He's a bright young man here to pursue his education. Education is the foundation of our future, especially the arts. It is a cornerstone of our civilization."

links.title: You: ""Your friend, the smoker on the bal..."
links.text: "Your friend, the smoker on the balcony. We were just talking about him."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But I told you, officer. He's a br..."
links.text: "But I told you, officer. He's a bright young man here to pursue his education. Education is the foundation of our future, especially the arts. It is a cornerstone of our civilization."

links.title: You: ""Fine, but what's his real name?""
links.text: "Fine, but what's his real name?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer, you have to understand......"
links.text: "Officer, you have to understand... I can't give you his personal information. I'm sure you have your own methods and databases, right? Please don't put me in this situation."

links.title: You: ""So all you can tell me about him i..."
links.text: "So all you can tell me about him is that he's here to study the arts?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""He's deeply enmeshed in the study..."
links.text: "He's deeply enmeshed in the study of the fine arts, yes."

links.title: Conceptualization: "As though you weren't envious enoug..."
links.text: As though you weren't envious enough of the boy as-is.

links.title: You: ""Which arts?""
links.text: "Which arts?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""He's a truly free spirit. He likes..."
links.text: "He's a truly free spirit. He likes all the arts. Perhaps graphic design? Printmaking? Who knows? The world is open wide for a talented youth like him."

links.title: You: ""What are you doing in his apartmen..."
links.text: "What are you doing in his apartment by yourself?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm just enjoying the view," the m..."
links.text: "I'm just enjoying the view," the man smiles, nodding to the window.

links.title: You: ""Enjoying the view? There's a dead..."
links.text: "Enjoying the view? There's a dead body hanging in the tree!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "A dead body..."
