links.text: The lieutenant sighs. "A dead body we still need to get down, by the way."

links.title: You: ""What view? It's dark outside.""
links.text: "What view? It's dark outside."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Listen," he says, raising his hand..."
links.text: "Listen," he says, raising his hand...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "A baby is crying in the neighbourin..."
links.text: A baby is crying in the neighbouring apartment.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Waves crashing in the distance, the..."
links.text: Waves crashing in the distance, the sound of sea below the window.

links.title: You: ""I can hear the waves.""
links.text: "I can hear the waves."

links.title: You: ""Someone's baby is bawling its eyes..."
links.text: "Someone's baby is bawling its eyes out."

links.title: You: ""Someone's baby is crying.""
links.text: "Someone's baby is crying."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, *listen*," he says again, look..."
links.text: "No, *listen*," he says again, looking outside...

links.title: You: ""What? I'm not hearing anything.""
links.text: "What? I'm not hearing anything."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The Insulindian Bay.""
links.text: "The Insulindian Bay."

links.title: You: ""What about it?""
links.text: "What about it?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""This place used to be a luxury acc..."
links.text: "This place used to be a luxury accommodation, before the Revolution. Apartments, of course, were much bigger then -- a few walls have been added here and there, leaving some of the tenants without a private bathroom or a kitchen..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But the million reál view stays. Y..."
links.text: "But the million reál view stays. You can't take that away." He knocks on the balcony door, his face mirrored in the darkened glass.

links.title: You: ""I was asking about your friend.""
links.text: "I was asking about your friend."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My friend comes and goes. I'm sure..."
links.text: "My friend comes and goes. I'm sure you'll see him around, he's a busy bee."

links.title: Rhetoric: "A busy bee? What an odd choice of w..."
links.text: A busy bee? What an odd choice of words.

links.title: You: ""Isn't it rude for your friend to l..."
links.text: "Isn't it rude for your friend to leave you alone like this?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""We're old friends, nothing's taboo..."
links.text: "We're old friends, nothing's taboo between us. He comes and goes."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm sure you'll see him around, he..."
links.text: "I'm sure you'll see him around, he's very active."

links.title: You: ""I had something else in mind...""
links.text: "I had something else in mind..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I'm all ears, officer.""
links.text: "I'm all ears, officer."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, my friend. My friend is a good..."
links.text: "Ah, my friend. My friend is a good young man. His family immigrated here from Kedra and life has not been easy for him. But he understands the importance of education. He has taken his future into his own hands and that's all that matters."

links.title: You: ""I'm trying to form a committee to..."
links.text: "I'm trying to form a committee to assign *la responsabilité*."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My friend, if it's *la responsabil..."
links.text: "My friend, if it's *la responsabilité* you're after, I have good news for you: There's no need to form such a committee, because it already exists!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""The Comité de Responsabilité de Re..."
links.text: "The Comité de Responsabilité de Revachol. It acts as a sort-of clearinghouse for Coalition activities. To put it simply, they are the ultimate arbiters of la responsabilité in this part of the world."

links.title: Empathy: "Yes, this is just the sort of reaso..."
links.text: Yes, this is just the sort of reasonable authority you're looking for!

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I would offer to connect you with..."
links.text: "I would offer to connect you with the committee myself, but alas, I am not actually *in* Martinaise."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "What? Where is he, then?"
links.text: What? Where is he, then?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You *knew* there was something stra..."
links.text: You *knew* there was something strange about this one! He's an astral projection, a phantasm!

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's speaking figuratively. He mean..."
links.text: He's speaking figuratively. He means he's not in Martinaise in his *official* capacity.

links.title: You: ""What are you talking about? I'm lo..."
links.text: "What are you talking about? I'm looking at you right now!"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Of course, we are speaking informa..."
links.text: "Of course, we are speaking informally, but *officially* I am still in La Delta, preparing for an upcoming conference on fuel oil derivatives..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's why it would be extremely i..."
links.text: "That's why it would be extremely irregular, or potentially even *inappropriate* for me to intercede with the Committee concerning a district I'm not officially in."

links.title: You: ""How am I supposed to contact the C..."
links.text: "How am I supposed to contact the Committee then?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: "The man frowns. "Well, under ordina..."
links.text: The man frowns. "Well, under ordinary circumstances, the Committee contacts *you*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "In other words, the committee only..."
links.text: In other words, the committee only knows what it *wants* to know.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But if you have information of a v..."
links.text: "But if you have information of a vital interest, they might be willing to entertain an exception. In which case, I would advise you to contact them via Coalition Warship Archer."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what's Coalition Warship Arc..."
links.text: "Wait, what's Coalition Warship Archer?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officer? You mean to say you haven..."
links.text: "Officer? You mean to say you haven't noticed the giant Coalition aerostatic peacefully patrolling the skies over Revachol?"

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You look out the window toward the..."
links.text: You look out the window toward the north. There, hanging some distance above the horison, you can just make out a strange silhouette...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It looks, to your eye, like some ki..."
links.text: It looks, to your eye, like some kind of long, metallic fish, suspended beneath a number of ceiling fans...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Not just any fish, it moves like so..."
links.text: Not just any fish, it moves like some ancient bottom-feeder gliding over the ocean floor in search of prey...

links.title: Half Light: "Don't let the paintjob fool you, it..."
links.text: Don't let the paintjob fool you, it's a goddamn killing machine, and there's nothing you can do to stop it!

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's about four-and-a-half kilometr..."
links.text: It's about four-and-a-half kilometres from your position, you estimate.

links.title: You: ""It's amazing. An inspiring symbol.""
links.text: "It's amazing. An inspiring symbol."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Isn't it? A triumph of both techni..."
links.text: "Isn't it? A triumph of both technical ingenuity and international cooperation. I, for one, feel much safer knowing it's up there, watching all of us."

links.title: You: ""It looks like a fish.""
links.text: "It looks like a fish."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Fascinating. I always thought it w..."
links.text: "Fascinating. I always thought it was more like a dragonfly. But isn't it interesting how humanity always finds inspiration in nature?"

links.title: You: ""It looks like a killing machine.""
links.text: "It looks like a killing machine."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Well, of course it *is* a heavily..."
links.text: "Well, of course it *is* a heavily armed and armoured warship with a full complement. But I assure you its purpose in Revachol is to *keep* the peace, not disturb it."

links.title: You: ""Huh. Can't believe I never noticed..."
links.text: "Huh. Can't believe I never noticed it before."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That is part of the idea, of cours..."
links.text: "That is part of the idea, of course. The Coalition doesn't want the people of Revachol to feel that they are under a *military* occupation. That is why the Archer is always careful to maintain a constant, discreet distance."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You look around, but you don't see..."
links.text: You look around, but you don't see anything unusual. Then again, your eyes aren't the sharpest...

links.title: You: ""Oh, right. The *Archer*. I thought..."
links.text: "Oh, right. The *Archer*. I thought you said... something else."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Ah, well, I'm glad to hear that at..."
links.text: "Ah, well, I'm glad to hear that at least. It would really be *quite unusual* for you to have never noticed it before..."

links.title: You: ""I don't think I've ever noticed it..."
links.text: "I don't think I've ever noticed it before."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Interesting. In a sense, that's th..."
links.text: "Interesting. In a sense, that's the very idea. The Coalition doesn't want the people of Revachol to feel that they are under a *military* occupation. That is why the Archer is always careful to maintain a constant, discreet distance."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You look out the window toward the..."
links.text: You look out the window toward the north. There, amidst the low-hanging stars, you can just make out signs of motion...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It's a set of position lights movin..."
links.text: It's a set of position lights moving in unison, like a restless constellation...

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, it's more like a creature from..."
links.text: No, it's more like a creature from the abyssopelagic zone, a great dark bioluminescent fish...

links.title: Half Light: "Don't let the shiny lights fool you..."
links.text: Don't let the shiny lights fool you, it's a goddamn killing machine, and there's nothing you can do to stop it!

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You look out the window, but you ca..."
links.text: You look out the window, but you can't see anything. But then, it's dark, and your eyes aren't the sharpest...

links.title: You: ""Why do I need to go through Archer..."
links.text: "Why do I need to go through Archer to speak to the Committee?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""You see, in addition to being an a..."
links.text: "You see, in addition to being an airborne artillery platform, Coalition Warship Archer is also the linchpin of the Coalition's surveillance and communications infrastructure in Revachol."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, it's *watching* us, too?""
links.text: "Hold on, it's *watching* us, too?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""And listening! It has the most obj..."
links.text: "And listening! It has the most objective vantage point in the entire city. Not to mention a vast array of radio, photographic, and meteorological monitoring instruments."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I find it a great comfort to know..."
links.text: "I find it a great comfort to know there are benevolent powers watching over all, in strict accordance with the Wayfarer Act and the Bristelmüne Conventions."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Bristelmüne Conventions are a s..."
links.text: The Bristelmüne Conventions are a series of international agreements governing the treatment of military personnel and civilians in theatres of war as well as occupied territories. In practice, they are more talked about than observed.

links.title: You: ""So how does one go about contactin..."
links.text: "So how does one go about contacting a Coalition warship?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""This is quite the problem, very tr..."
links.text: "This is quite the problem, very tricky. Of course, the Archer has orders to fire on any unidentified aerostatics that might approach it, so it might be safer to get in touch *from the ground*..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""But in that case, you would requir..."
links.text: "But in that case, you would require a radio transmitter capable of broadcasting on Coalition frequencies. And that kind of technology naturally isn't typically available for non-Coalition use. Yes, it *is* a bit of a conundrum."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I suppose there might be some way..."
links.text: "I suppose there might be some way to *circuit-bend* your way onto those frequencies, but you'd have to be one of those *techno-tinkerers* to do it."

links.title: You: ""Do you know any of these tinkerers?""
links.text: "Do you know any of these tinkerers?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Unfortunately not, no, I don't hav..."
links.text: "Unfortunately not, no, I don't have the pleasure. I am merely a representative of the Coalition Government, not very well-versed in technology..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm, sounds like something that p..."
links.text: "Hmmm, sounds like something that programmer we met in the church might be able to help with..."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Let me just say that I have *compl..."
links.text: "Let me just say that I have *complete confidence* in the RCM. I'm sure you'll figure something out."

links.title: Empathy: "This sounds like something that pro..."
links.text: This sounds like something that programmer you met in the church might help with...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmmm, perhaps your young friends i..."
links.text: "Hmmm, perhaps your young friends in the *tent* might be of assistance?"

links.title: Empathy: "Perhaps your new friends in the ten..."
links.text: Perhaps your new friends in the tent might be able to help you?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, good: 'Techno-tinkerers.' Just..."
links.text: "Oh, good: 'Techno-tinkerers.' Just what this *side task* was missing..."

links.title: Empathy: "You *will* figure it out. Something..."
links.text: You *will* figure it out. Something tells you the person you're looking for is already on this coast...

links.title: You: ""Is that... legal?""
links.text: "Is that... legal?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Unauthorised circuit-bending is a..."
links.text: "Unauthorised circuit-bending is a very serious matter with grave security implications, but as of the moment there is no specific law *forbidding* it, in Revachol at least..."

links.title: You: ""So what am I supposed to do?""
links.text: "So what am I supposed to do?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That, my friend, is your responsab..."
links.text: "That, my friend, is your responsabilité. I cannot take it from you, nor can you delegate it to someone else..."

links.title: You: ""Are you saying I should just give..."
links.text: "Are you saying I should just give up?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I don't mean to discourage you, of..."
links.text: "I don't mean to discourage you, of course, just to say that it won't be *easy* to reach the Committee."

links.title: Logic: "Not exactly a model of accessible a..."
links.text: Not exactly a model of accessible and accountable governance...

links.title: You: ""But this is an urgent matter. I *n..."
links.text: "But this is an urgent matter. I *need* to get in touch with the Committee."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Yes, you've made your *persistence..."
links.text: "Yes, you've made your *persistence* quite clear. Under normal circumstances I would have to insist you go through the regular channels."

links.title: Volition: "No, no. You can't let them give you..."
links.text: No, no. You can't let them give you the runaround.

links.title: You: "(Attempt to stick your hand through..."
links.text: (Attempt to stick your hand through his astral form.)

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Mais que faites-vous, officer?" Yo..."
links.text: "Mais que faites-vous, officer?" Your hand bumps up against the man's solid if somewhat fleshy chest.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I was wondering the same thin..."
links.text: "Yes, I was wondering the same thing."

links.title: You: ""You said you weren't really here...."
links.text: "You said you weren't really here. I had to make sure you weren't an astral projection."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""No, no, don't be silly. We're simp..."
links.text: "No, no, don't be silly. We're simply speaking in an informal capacity. *Officially* I am still in La Delta, preparing for an upcoming conference on fuel oil derivatives..."

links.title: You: ""Nothing, just lost my balance a mo..."
links.text: "Nothing, just lost my balance a moment."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Perhaps your blood sugar is a bit..."
links.text: "Perhaps your blood sugar is a bit low? As I was saying, *officially* speaking I am still in La Delta, preparing for an upcoming conference on fuel oil derivatives..."

links.title: You: ""I got it. You're only here on *per..."
links.text: "I got it. You're only here on *personal* business."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Précisément. *Officially* I am sti..."
links.text: "Précisément. *Officially* I am still in La Delta, preparing for an upcoming conference on fuel oil derivatives..."

links.title: You: ""So... where *are* you, then?""
links.text: "So... where *are* you, then?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Why, *officially* I am still in La..."
links.text: "Why, *officially* I am still in La Delta, preparing for an upcoming conference on fuel oil derivatives. I'm only in Martinaise in an unofficial capacity..."

links.title: You: ""Thanks, I've got all I need." [Lea..."
links.text: "Thanks, I've got all I need." [Leave.]

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Of course, I'm sorry I couldn't be..."
links.text: "Of course, I'm sorry I couldn't be the 'break' you were looking for. Good luck with the investigation."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Of course, I'm glad I could help.""
links.text: "Of course, I'm glad I could help."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""A moment, officer.""
links.text: "A moment, officer."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Do you have everything you need fr..."
links.text: "Do you have everything you need from me? I'm afraid we won't have the chance to speak again once you leave."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, why can't we talk later?""
links.text: "Hold on, why can't we talk later?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""It's against diplomatic best pract..."
links.text: "It's against diplomatic best practices for an official in my position to be discussing murders with local militiamen." He pauses. "And I'm pressed for time. After you leave, I should be leaving as well."

links.title: Logic: "That's not the real reason he's so..."
links.text: That's not the real reason he's so apprehensive -- men in his position shouldn't be seen loitering around in underprivileged young men's apartments in the middle of the night.

links.title: You: ""I'm not going anywhere, I just wan..."
links.text: "I'm not going anywhere, I just want to take a look around in this apartment." [Leave.]

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Sure, go ahead, it's a beautiful s..."
links.text: "Sure, go ahead, it's a beautiful space." He glances at his watch. "Let me know if you have any further questions."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for the heads up, but my wo..."
links.text: "Thanks for the heads up, but my work here is done." [Leave.]

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Already?" He glances at his watch...."
links.text: "Already?" He glances at his watch. "Well, I'm glad I could help."

dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""You have acquired the hat." He ass..."
dialogueTree.text: "You have acquired the hat." He assesses the situation. "Keep it, officer, it looks good on you."

links.title: Suggestion: "The tone somehow suggests to you th..."
links.text: The tone somehow suggests to you that you're starting to become a little sponsored by him as well.

dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""You have acquired the robe." He as..."
dialogueTree.text: "You have acquired the robe." He assesses the situation. "Keep it, officer, it looks good on you."

dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""You have acquired the hat." The ma..."
dialogueTree.text: "You have acquired the hat." The man assesses the situation. "Keep it, officer, it looks good on you."

links.title: Authority: "You shouldn't be seeing him in an i..."
links.text: You shouldn't be seeing him in an intimate setting. For some reason you feel this man is your... *superior*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Superior? But he's not in the comma..."
links.text: Superior? But he's not in the command chain...

links.title: Composure: "His hands are clean and well-manicu..."
links.text: His hands are clean and well-manicured. This is a man who knows the importance of appearances.

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""My name is Charles Villedrouin and..."
links.text: "My name is Charles Villedrouin and I'm an official with the Coalition Government. I work for the Institute of Price Stabilité, on assignment from Sur-la-Clef."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I heard you talking to my friend o..."
links.text: "I heard you talking to my friend outside... Very good. Super. I am here to assist you in any way possible. Ask me about the hanging."

links.title: Suggestion: "No, first ask an innocuous personal..."
links.text: No, first ask an innocuous personal question to get the interview off on the right foot.

links.title: Authority: "Yes. Make it clear you're the one s..."
links.text: Yes. Make it clear you're the one setting the terms here...

links.title: Half Light: "Yeah, *yeah*! Let's *fuck* with him..."
links.text: Yeah, *yeah*! Let's *fuck* with him! Who does he think he is, assisting *you*?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Hanging? What a drag. He seems like..."
links.text: Hanging? What a drag. He seems like a *cultured* gentleman -- you should ask him about the finer things...

links.title: You: "(Point at the bed.) "Before we go o..."
links.text: (Point at the bed.) "Before we go on, I absolutely *have* to inquire about this wonderful canopy."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh yes, my friend has a great eye..."
links.text: "Oh yes, my friend has a great eye for these things. He refuses to tell me where it came from -- it's a mystery. Hehehe." He smiles. "I believe they call this type of frame *industrial*. It's very comfy."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""That's really all I can tell you a..."
links.text: "That's really all I can tell you about it." He forms a little rooftop with his fingers. Cold air sweeps in from the balcony.

links.title: Authority: "That didn't work at all."
links.text: That didn't work at all.

links.title: Half Light: "What was *that*?! You were supposed..."
links.text: What was *that*?! You were supposed to *fuck* with him, not compliment the décor!

links.title: You: "(Show him the silk robe.) "Before w..."
links.text: (Show him the silk robe.) "Before we get to that, tell me where you got this *beautiful* silk robe from?"

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Oh, we got it from an atelier in t..."
links.text: "Oh, we got it from an atelier in the East Delta Commerce Centre. Personally I think it's a little culturally insensitive, but the material is great. Sadly the shop is now out of business..."

links.title: You: "(Point to the silk robe.) "Before w..."
links.text: (Point to the silk robe.) "Before we get to that, tell me where you got this *beautiful* silk robe from?"

links.title: You: "(Show him the Samaran hat.) "We'll..."
links.text: (Show him the Samaran hat.) "We'll get to that. Right after you tell me the story behind the black Samaran hat."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""I got it from the head of the Sama..."
links.text: "I got it from the head of the Samaran delegation on my trip to Lo-Manthang. It's made from a *special* charcoal-coloured bamboo. It's an emblem of the formal normalization of our diplomatic relations."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's alluding to the decade-long wa..."
links.text: He's alluding to the decade-long war of independence while deftly brushing aside the *complex* causes behind the conflict.

links.title: You: "(Point to the Samaran hat.) "We'll..."
links.text: (Point to the Samaran hat.) "We'll get to that. Right after you tell me the story behind the black Samaran hat."

links.title: You: "(Get down to business.) "Hello, Mr...."
links.text: (Get down to business.) "Hello, Mr. Villedrouin. Let's get started."

links.title: Sunday Friend: ""Of course. Let me just say it has..."
links.text: "Of course. Let me just say it has been an emotional week for me." He forms a little rooftop with his fingers. Cold air comes in from the balcony.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes out his notebo..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes out his notebook and nods to you to proceed.

dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""You have acquired the robe." The m..."
dialogueTree.text: "You have acquired the robe." The man assesses the situation. "Keep it, officer, it looks good on you."

dialogueTree.title: Sunday Friend: ""Officers of the Revachol Citizens..."
dialogueTree.text: "Officers of the Revachol Citizens Militia." The man in business-casual removes his cuff links.
